skill.name: Testing Skill
skill.description: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.summary: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill containing no executable code. It provides testing guidance including pytest commands, patterns, and best practices. No network calls, file writes, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Writing and maintaining tests is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates test generation, review, and execution using pytest best practices with coverage tracking and pattern enforcement.
actual_capabilities: Generate pytest test cases for Python functions and classes
Review existing tests for quality and coverage gaps
Execute tests with coverage analysis and reporting
Apply AAA pattern and fixture best practices
Organize tests into unit, integration, e2e, and specialized categories
Run mutation testing and property-based tests
limitations: Does not execute tests directly without user confirmation
Does not modify production code without explicit approval
Cannot generate tests for non-Python languages

use_cases.title: Automated Test Writing
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive test suites for new or existing Python functions with AAA pattern implementation

use_cases.title: Test Quality Review
use_cases.description: Review existing test suites for coverage gaps, missing edge cases, and pattern violations

use_cases.title: CI Coverage Enforcement
use_cases.description: Enforce minimum 80% coverage standards and generate HTML coverage reports for CI pipelines

prompt_templates.title: Generate Unit Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate pytest unit tests for the following function. Apply the AAA pattern and include edge case coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Review Test Suite
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my test suite in the tests/ directory. Identify coverage gaps, missing edge cases, and pattern violations.

prompt_templates.title: Add Coverage Tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure pytest coverage with HTML and terminal reports. Ensure minimum 80% coverage threshold is enforced.

prompt_templates.title: Implement Fixtures
prompt_templates.prompt: Create pytest fixtures in conftest.py for the test data needed across multiple test files. Document each fixture's purpose.

output_examples.input: Generate tests for my user authentication function
output: Generated 5 test cases covering valid login, invalid password, account lockout, token expiration, and SQL injection prevention
Applied AAA pattern with proper fixture for test user data

best_practices: Apply the AAA pattern (Arrange-Act-Assert) for clear test structure
Use pytest fixtures for reusable test data and setup
Enforce minimum 80% coverage for all new code contributions
anti_patterns: Avoid testing multiple assertions in a single test case
Do not use magic numbers without explanation in tests
Avoid tight coupling between tests through shared mutable state

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: Supports Python 3.8+ for pytest 7+ compatibility. Best results with Python 3.10+ using standard typing patterns.

faq.question: What is the minimum coverage requirement?
faq.answer: Default minimum is 80% line coverage with branch coverage enabled. This can be configured per project.

faq.question: Can this skill work with existing test frameworks?
faq.answer: Designed for pytest but can work alongside unittest. Provides patterns applicable to any xUnit-style testing.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All test generation happens locally. Coverage reports are generated on your machine only.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing after generation?
faq.answer: Check that fixtures are properly defined and imported. Verify test data matches expected formats. Run pytest with verbose output for debugging.

faq.question: How is this different from Codex or Copilot test generation?
faq.answer: Focuses on pytest best practices and coverage enforcement. Provides context-aware patterns and applies project-specific conventions automatically.
